messages.message:
Hey team, is there an easy way for users to build custom validation functions for extracted tables in Build? It looks like tables are currently extracted as Markdown strings. If someone wants to run some validation code on a table to check specific rows or cells, it feels like it would be a very involved process for users to do so (I haven't stumbled across a simple way to convert Markdown tables to JSON/pandas etc).

I know that data types are coming to AI Hub soon, and turning on that flag does change the extracted field result inside the custom function - but the result is still a string. I wonder if, given that we know the extracted result will be a table in this case, that the extracted field should be transformed into a different type before being presented to the user?

CC: @lydia @Eric Han @Travis 

i think this might be a good opportunity to do some form of data normalization for results coming out of extraction. it would help with both validation udfs but also human review and integration udfs
I’ll be glad to dive into this a bit to come up with a way that all “types” in AIHub can pass through one handler so we have a source of truth on this.
It’s just a matter of having definitions of how data is transformed and hopefully everything can start to fall into place after that.
